properties.name: Arena Saint-Michel rainwater recuperation
properties.description: System that captures rainwater, filters and reuses it for the arena. Implemented to help with sewer overloading during rainstorms.

properties.name:
Regulate the construction and
renovation of roofs (public and
private buildings) to favour the
reduction of heat islands
properties.description: Regulation that requires that roofs be painted with a reflective paint instead of black. To reduce UHI effect

properties.name:
Change the urban planning
regulations to ensure that front
yards remain green spaces
and prohibit them from being
transformed into hard surfaces
(ashpalt, concrete, etc.)
properties.description: Permeable surfaces such as vegetation help prevent both water pooling and help reduce heat absorption.

properties.name:
Choose plants that are adapted to
new climate conditions
properties.description: Implemented in an ongoing fashion in Borough greening projects. No further information.

properties.name: Boost the frequency of street sweeping in order to reduce the quantity of debris carried off by rainwater
properties.description: Sweeping the entire Borough at least once a week in the summer reduces debris buildup in manholes. Helpes to ensure proper water flows during heavy rains

properties.name:
Increase the use of continuous tree
trenches
properties.description: Implemented during complete street rebuilds. Continuous tree trenches give more room for tree roots to grow, as well as more permeable surface to control storm water runoff and rainwater.

properties.name:
Use permeable coverings (porous
asphalt, porous concrete, concrete
pavement and honeycomb systems
in concrete or plastic) in municipal
projects
properties.description: Permeable surfaces reduce risks of water pooling and flash flooding during heavy rainfalls. This regulation would be applied during renovations or new municipal projects.

properties.name: Plant, conserve and protect trees – Greening
properties.description: Borough goal to plant 600 trees per year. Tree planting reduces UHI while improving a number of situations - such as noise and air pollution, and creating shade.

properties.name: Create green and sponge alleys
properties.description: Borough goal to create 6 "ruelles vertes" each year. These ruelles include new vegetation, permeable pavement and less cemented surfaces. This goal could be way more ambitious.

properties.name: Create shaded areas
properties.description: Borough plan to create 30 shaded areas per year. Shaded areas are useful for reducing UHI and improving safety during extreme heat events.

properties.name:
Increase the number of air-
conditioned public spaces and 
plan to extend service during 
heat waves (schools, community 
centres, etc.)
properties.description: Air conditioned spaces can save lives during extreme heat events

properties.name: Use the city's land to test out more natural landscaping
properties.description: Borough plan for one extra site per year of testing. The Saint-Michel area has a disproportionate amount of municipal properties, so city initiatives can use the area for new greening plans easily.

properties.name: Begin implementing a separate sewer system
properties.description: Montréal could finally rid itself of sewage overflow during heavy rainfall. It's an incremental, long-term initiative.

properties.name: Sunken driveway ban
properties.description: Banning this in new development would see the flood risk and damages eventually reduce over the longterm

properties.name: Longterm rehabilitation of Carrière Francon
properties.description: A similar project to Frederich Back could be undertaken to create a new green space with sponge and cooling effects, and would surely lead to reduced vulnerability to heat waves, rain flooding, and other climate hazards in the area between the two spaces.

properties.name: Implement a pest management plan
properties.description: A pest management plan is overdue for the borough, seeing as climate-induced pest migration becomes a pressing issue for less-biodiverse urban green spaces

properties.name: Use Frederic-Back Park welcome center for climate adaptation education
properties.description: The welcome center educates on the history of the park, why not look to the future and encourage citizens to do their part to increase their resiliency to climate change.
